title: World's most expensive Indo-US NISAR satellite likely to be launched in March: Nasa - The Times of India
summary:
World's most expensive Indo-US NISAR satellite likely to be launched in March: Nasa

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The article discusses the anticipated launch of NASA's Indo-US NISAR satellite, which is deemed the most expensive satellite of its kind. Scheduled for March, this satellite aims to enhance Earth observation capabilities.

  • The NISAR satellite represents a collaborative effort between India and the USA.
  • It is designed to monitor changes in the Earth's surface and understand various environmental processes.
  • The project emphasizes advanced technology and international cooperation in space exploration.
"The NISAR satellite is expected to revolutionize our understanding of the planet's ecosystems and natural disasters."

This launch signifies a notable milestone in international space collaboration, aiming to bring valuable data for scientific research and environmental monitoring.
newTitle: Launch of Indo-US NISAR Satellite Set for March by NASA

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath impressed a Japanese delegation with his nearly two-minute opening remarks given in Japanese, which received wide applause.

  • Yogi Adityanath welcomed Kotaro Nagasaki, Governor of Yamanashi Prefecture, and highlighted the cultural ties between India and Japan.
  • An MoU was signed to promote industrial development, tourism, and vocational education collaboration between Uttar Pradesh and Yamanashi.
  • Adityanath expressed hope for economic and cultural exchanges and emphasized the shared values strengthening India-Japan ties.
“Had a productive meeting and fruitful discussion with Mr. Kotaro Nagasaki... Looking forward to exploring new opportunities for economic and cultural exchange together,” said Yogi Adityanath.

This meeting represents a significant step towards enhancing bilateral relations and collaboration between India and Japan.

Vitamin D has no role to play in preventing fractures: New Research - The Times of India
summary:
Vitamin D has no role to play in preventing fractures: New Research

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

New research from the US Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) indicates that Vitamin D supplements do not prevent falls or fractures in older adults.

  • The USPSTF recommends against taking Vitamin D with or without calcium for older adults aged 60 and over who live at home.
  • Falling is a primary cause of injury in older adults, but increases in risk of kidney stones have been noted with unnecessary supplementation.
  • Effective preventive services for falls include screening for osteoporosis and structured exercise programs.
  • The recommendations do not apply to those taking Vitamin D for medical reasons or individuals diagnosed with conditions affecting Vitamin D absorption.
“Unfortunately, when we reviewed the latest evidence, we found that taking vitamin D with or without calcium does not prevent falls or fractures in older adults.” - John M. Ruiz, Ph.D., USPSTF member.

The findings emphasize the need for alternative preventive methods for maintaining bone health in older adults.
newTitle: Vitamin D Ineffective in Preventing Fractures, According to New Research

title: Oppo Reno 13 Series 5G confirmed to launch in India: Expected price, features, and specs | Mint - Mint
summary:
Oppo Reno 13 Series 5G Confirmed for India: Price, Features, and Specs

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: OPPO India

Oppo has officially confirmed the launch of its Reno 13 series 5G smartphones in India, following the success of the Reno 12 series. The release will feature two models: Reno 13 5G and Reno 13 Pro 5G, with significant design upgrades and innovative specifications.

  • Launch details were teased, although the exact date is not yet available.
  • Design upgrades include a premium aluminium frame and a sculpted glass back.
  • The devices will feature a triple-camera setup with a unique triangular design.
  • Display specifications include a 6.59-inch AMOLED display, 2760x1256 resolution, 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Powered by MediaTek Dimensity 8350 chipset with a 5,600mAh battery and 80W fast charging.
  • The camera setup includes a 50MP primary sensor with OIS and a 50MP front camera for selfies.
  • Running on ColorOS 15 based on Android 15.
  • Expected pricing in China starts at CNY 2,699 (approx. ₹31,400), with Indian pricing yet to be announced.

“Familiar, yet so refreshingly new. Can you guess what’s coming?” — OPPO India (@OPPOIndia) December 23, 2024

The upcoming launch is aimed at appealing to both camera enthusiasts and gamers, promising high performance and cutting-edge technology.
newTitle: Oppo Reno 13 Series 5G Confirmed for India: Price, Features, and Specs

title: Shyam Benegal dies: Akshay Kumar, Manoj Bajpayee and Shekhar Kapur mourn demise of veteran filmmaker, call him 'legend' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Shyam Benegal dies: Akshay Kumar, Manoj Bajpayee and Shekhar Kapur mourn demise of veteran filmmaker, call him 'legend'

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Shyam Benegal, celebrated Indian filmmaker, passed away on December 23 at the age of 90. His death has prompted an outpouring of tributes from Bollywood celebrities who remembered him as a legend and visionary in Indian cinema.

  • Benegal had recently celebrated his 90th birthday.
  • He was known for his pioneering work in Indian parallel cinema.
  • His daughter confirmed his passing, citing the great loss it represents.
  • He won multiple National Awards and was honored with Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan.
“Pained to know of Shyam Benegal ji’s demise. One of the finest filmmakers in our country, truly a legend. Om Shanti.” - Akshay Kumar
“A heartbreaking loss for Indian cinema...his legacy will live on in the stories he told and the lives he touched.” - Manoj Bajpayee

Benegal's influence on Indian cinema is celebrated widely, and his legacy as a storyteller will continue to inspire future generations.
newTitle: Shyam Benegal dies: Tributes from Bollywood stars

title: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Achieves Closest Sun Flyby Ever on December 24 - Gadgets 360
summary:
NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Achieves Closest Sun Flyby Ever on December 24

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Gadgets360

The Parker Solar Probe is set to perform its closest flyby of the sun, travelling within 3.8 million miles of its surface, at an unprecedented speed of 430,000 mph.

  • The probe will collect data on the sun's corona during its 22nd solar approach.
  • NASA confirms the spacecraft is functioning normally ahead of the record-setting flyby.
  • Future flybys are scheduled for March 22 and June 19, 2025.
  • The probe's advanced heat shield will protect its instruments from extreme temperatures of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
“The probe will provide unprecedented data from regions no spacecraft has explored before.” - Nick Pinkine, mission operations manager at JHUAPL

The results from the Parker Solar Probe's flyby will enhance our understanding of solar phenomena and the sun's behavior, with significant implications for solar science.
newTitle: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Achieves Closest Sun Flyby Ever on December 24

title: Tanush Kotian to join India's Test squad as Ashwin's replacement - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Tanush Kotian to Join India's Test Squad as Ashwin's Replacement

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Tanush Kotian, a talented offspin-bowling allrounder from Mumbai, has been chosen to replace R Ashwin in India's Test squad for the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy Tests.

  • Kotian will fly to Melbourne following Ashwin's retirement after the third Test.
  • He is in Ahmedabad for the Vijay Hazare Trophy as part of the Mumbai squad.
  • The fourth Test starts on Thursday, with the series being tied 1-1.
  • Kotian has a first-class record of 101 wickets and 1525 runs in 33 matches.
  • He was instrumental in Mumbai's Ranji Trophy success, earning the Player-of-the-Tournament award.
  • Kotian is alongside Manav Suthar in being viewed as a future prospect for the India Test setup.
“Kotian was the only player to complete the season double of 500 runs and 25 wickets.”

This inclusion highlights Kotian's rising profile and adds depth to India's spinning options as they navigate the crucial Test matches ahead.
newTitle: Tanush Kotian to Join India's Test Squad as Ashwin's Replacement

title: Ruling, Opposition leaders join protesters outside CM Omar Abdullah’s residence over J&K reservation policy - The Hindu
summary:
Ruling, Opposition leaders join protesters outside CM Omar Abdullah’s residence over J&K reservation policy

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: The Hindu

On December 23, 2024, a significant protest took place outside the residence of Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah in Srinagar, where various political leaders joined numerous students from the general category demanding a rationalisation of the existing reservation policy in the Union Territory.

  • Mainstream leaders including Aga Syed Ruhullah from the NC and Iltija Mufti from the PDP protested together with aggrieved students.
  • Students criticized the new reservation policy that disproportionately benefits reserved categories, reducing open merit opportunities to less than 40%.
  • MP Ruhullah articulated the need for a fair reservation system based on population ratios or adhering to the Supreme Court's guidelines.
  • Solidarity was shown amongst different political factions, including both the ruling and opposition parties, highlighting the political and social implications of the policy.
  • The Chief Minister has promised a dialogue with student representatives regarding their concerns.
“Our future is in the dark if the current policy goes on.” - AIP legislator MLA Sheikh Khurshid

This protest marks a crucial moment, reflecting the intense public sentiment towards the reservation framework in Jammu and Kashmir, and thus poses significant challenges for the regional government.
newTitle: Protests Erupt Over J&K Reservation Policy as Leaders Join Students Outside CM's Residence

summary:
10 Health Benefits of Eating Black Pepper Regularly

Black pepper is often referred to as the 'king of spices' and offers multiple health benefits, including boosting metabolism and enhancing digestion. Here are 10 reasons to include black pepper in your diet.

  • Rich in antioxidants, fighting oxidative stress.
  • Helps relieve cough and cold symptoms.
  • Aids digestion and enhances nutrient absorption.
  • Stimulates blood circulation for better cardiovascular health.
  • Promotes skin health with antibacterial properties.
  • Enhances brain function and memory.
  • Supports immune function with antimicrobial properties.
  • Improves absorption of essential nutrients like curcumin.
  • Contains anti-inflammatory compounds.

title: Shyam Benegal — the boy from Alwal who put Hyderabad on national movie map - The Hindu
summary:
Shyam Benegal — the boy from Alwal who put Hyderabad on national movie map

Published on: December 23, 2024 at 09:55 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

Shyam Benegal, a significant figure in Indian cinema, passed away recently, leaving behind a legacy of films shot in and around Hyderabad, which shaped the national film landscape.

  • Benegal was born in Alwal on December 14, 1934, and witnessed India's Freedom Struggle.
  • His films often spotlighted social issues, including the Telangana Armed Struggle.
  • Notable films include Ankur, Nishant, and Well Done Abba.
  • He collaborated with famous playwrights and actors, elevating the status of parallel cinema in India.
“He always responded to messages and calls, so when there was no response on December 15 for the birthday greetings, I was expecting the worst.”

Shyam Benegal's contributions to film have had a lasting impact, influencing generations of filmmakers and audiences alike.
newTitle: Shyam Benegal — the boy from Alwal who put Hyderabad on national movie map

title: Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement In India's Border Gavaskar Trophy Squad Named. Not Axar Patel Or Y.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement In India's Border Gavaskar Trophy Squad Named. Not Axar Patel Or Yuzvendra Chahal

Publication Date: December 24, 2024Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team has chosen a spinner-allrounder, Tanush Kotian, to replace Ravichandran Ashwin, who recently announced his retirement after a match. Kotian, who has no international experience, will be heading to Australia to join the squad.

  • Kotian has a record of 101 wickets in 33 First Class matches.
  • He has also performed well in List A and T20 formats.
  • Ashwin retired after a prominent career, being India's second-highest wicket-taker.
  • Originally, Axar Patel was expected to replace Ashwin but opted for a break due to personal reasons.
“I made myself a promise in 2012, we lost a tricky series against England. I was very early in my career and I was just telling myself we are not gonna lose another one. Ever.” – Ravichandran Ashwin

With Ashwin's exit, Kotian's inclusion represents a significant moment for the young spinner as he steps into a historic series.
newTitle: Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement Named for Border Gavaskar Trophy

title: Tanush Kotian added to India's squad for the last two Tests against Australia - The Times of India
summary:
Tanush Kotian added to India's squad for the last two Tests against Australia

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: Times of India

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has announced the addition of all-rounder Tanush Kotian to the Indian cricket squad for the fourth and fifth Tests of the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

  • Kotian, an off-spinner from Mumbai, has been rewarded for his impressive performances in domestic cricket.
  • He has taken 101 wickets in 33 first-class matches at an average of 25.70, including three five-wicket hauls.
  • Kotian has scored two centuries and 13 half-centuries.
  • The 24-year-old's standout performances in the 2023-24 Ranji Trophy season helped Mumbai achieve victory.
  • He was named Player of the Tournament, scoring 502 runs at an average of 41.83 and taking 29 wickets at an average of 16.96.
  • Kotian replaces R Ashwin, who announced his retirement after the third Test.
Kotian's addition provides the Indian team with an additional spin-bowling option and batting depth as they aim to clinch the series against the formidable Australian side.

The series is currently tied at 1-1 after three Tests, making these upcoming matches crucial for both teams.
newTitle: Tanush Kotian added to India's squad for the last two Tests against Australia

title: "Wanted To Leave Things Behind As...": Ravichandran Ashwin Ends Silence On Abruptly Retiring Mid-Ser.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
"Wanted To Leave Things Behind As...": Ravichandran Ashwin Ends Silence On Abruptly Retiring Mid-Series In Australia

Publication Date: September 22, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

Ravichandran Ashwin surprised fans and analysts alike with his decision to retire from international cricket after the third Test against Australia. This decision comes as he was the highest wicket-taker among active bowlers at 537 wickets.

  • Ashwin retired with two Tests remaining in the Border Gavaskar Trophy.
  • His retirement raised eyebrows from cricket legends including Sunil Gavaskar.
  • India's captain Rohit Sharma commented on Ashwin's decision, indicating it was made based on his perceived relevance to the series.
  • Ashwin expressed that he has always wanted to leave the game without fanfare, valuing the game above personal celebration.
  • He mentioned that he felt his creative inspiration was dwindling, prompting thoughts of retirement.
  • Ashwin reflected on his journey, emphasizing the connection between his cricketing career and personal growth.
"I've got no regrets because I've had to do it the hard way, but it has left me with the idea that the game has been my calling." - Ravichandran Ashwin

In conclusion, Ashwin's retirement marks the end of a significant chapter in cricket, reflecting his unique approach to the sport and his personal philosophy about life and its pursuits.
newTitle: Ravichandran Ashwin Discusses His Sudden Retirement from International Cricket

title: Delhi LG VK Saxena blames Arvind Kejriwal for Yamuna pollution: ‘I personally hold you responsible’ - Hindustan Times
summary:

Date: Dec 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi lieutenant governor Vinai Kumar Saxena has publicly criticized former chief minister Arvind Kejriwal, attributing the severe pollution in the Yamuna River to his actions, including interference with cleaning efforts.

  • Saxena accused Kejriwal of halting pollution clean-up operations mandated by the Supreme Court.
  • The Yamuna has reportedly reached unprecedented pollution levels this year.
  • Saxena reiterated his requests for Kejriwal to personally assess the pollution situation.
  • This incident follows prior instances of Saxena holding Kejriwal accountable for the river's declining condition.
“The Yamuna has reached its highest level of pollution this year. I will personally hold you responsible for this.” - Vinai Kumar Saxena

The ongoing conflict highlights the contentious relationship between Delhi's current and former leadership regarding environmental management and accountability.

Chile’s WOM Cleared to Exit Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Proceedings | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Chile’s WOM Cleared to Exit Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Proceedings

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Bloomberg

The Chilean telecommunications company WOM has been granted court approval to exit Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings, following a takeover and restructuring agreement with a group of creditors.

  • WOM filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy eight months ago.
  • A takeover bid from a group of bondholders valued WOM at $1.6 billion.
  • The agreement includes a $500 million investment and a net debt reduction of $650 million.
  • The decision was made by a US bankruptcy judge, rejecting a rival creditor's objection.
  • WOM has approximately 20% of the mobile market share in Chile, ranking third behind Telefonica's Movistar and Entel.
“The decision is a landmark in the Chapter 11 process and the efforts we have made as a team to financially restructure the company.” - Martín Vaca Narvaja, WOM’s CEO

This restructuring plan ensures the operational continuity of WOM Chile and sets the stage for its future growth.
newTitle: Chile’s WOM Cleared to Exit Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Proceedings

summary:
Vinod Kambli Diagnosed with Brain Clots; Hospital Offers Free Treatment

Date: Dec 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Vinod Kambli, former Indian cricketer, has been diagnosed with clots in his brain after being admitted to the hospital following a health decline over the weekend. The hospital has committed to providing him with lifelong free treatment.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital due to urinary infection and cramps.
  • Doctors found clots in his brain after conducting examinations.
  • The hospital's medical in-charge announced lifelong free treatment for Kambli.
  • Kambli suffered a previous collapse due to health issues about a month ago.
  • Concerns from cricket legends like Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar regarding his health were noted.
"I was suffering from a urine problem... My head started spinning; I collapsed and fell down." - Vinod Kambli

Kambli's health situation is being closely monitored, and he is receiving additional medical examinations as needed.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli Diagnosed with Brain Clots; Hospital Offers Free Treatment

More reasons to cheer for tea, coffee lovers as latest research shows they can prevent cancer - The Times of India
summary:
Tea and Coffee May Help Prevent Head and Neck Cancer, Research Shows

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

The latest research indicates that both tea and coffee drinkers may have a lower risk of developing head and neck cancer, establishing both beverages as potentially protective against certain cancers.

  • Studies suggest reduced risk of head and neck cancers among consumers of tea and coffee.
  • Data from 14 studies analyzed 9,548 cancer patients and 15,783 controls.
  • Drinking more than 4 cups of caffeinated coffee daily can lower the risk of throat cancer by 22% and oral cancer by 30%.
  • Decaffeinated coffee and tea also show potential protective effects.
“This study highlighted their varying effects with different sub-sites of head and neck cancer.” - Yuan-Chin Amy Lee, PhD

These findings stress the importance of further research into how our beverage choices may contribute to cancer prevention.
newTitle: Tea and Coffee May Help Prevent Head and Neck Cancer, Research Shows

title: 'Attempt to create hatred': BJP on Rahul Gandhi meeting Parbhani victim's kin - The Times of India
summary:
BJP Criticizes Rahul Gandhi's Meeting with Victim's Family

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

In a recent controversy, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) expressed opposition to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's visit with the family of a victim from Parbhani. The BJP accused Gandhi of attempting to foster hatred through his actions.

  • The BJP labeled Rahul Gandhi's meeting as a political maneuver.
  • They claimed it was an attempt to intensify communal tensions.
  • Gandhi's engagement has evoked a mixed response from different political factions.
“Attempts to create hatred are unacceptable,” BJP spokesperson stated.

This incident highlights the ongoing political rivalry and the sensitive nature of communal issues in the region.
newTitle: BJP Criticizes Rahul Gandhi's Meeting with Victim's Family
